Sentencas: To enhance the power generation efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), the use of proton-conducting solid solutions of doped BaCeO3 and doped BaZrO3, with formulas of the Ba(Zr0.1Ce0.7Y0.1X0.1)O3-delta (X = Ga, Sc, In, Yb, Gd), was investigated as SOFCs electrolyte materials with respect to both chemical stability and electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Regarding chemical stability, the weight changes of each material were measured under a CO2 atmosphere in a temperature range of 1200 C-omicron-600 C-omicron.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Higher chemical stability was observed for dopant ions with smaller radii.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Regarding conductivity, the dependences of the total conductivities on the oxygen partial pressure and temperature were measured in the temperature range of 600 C-omicron-900 C-omicron.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: In each material, the total conductivity was proportional to the oxygen partial pressure to the 1/4 power at high oxygen partial pressures, as previously observed for accepter-doped proton conducting perovskite-type oxides.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: The derived conductivities for each type of charge carrier showed that the hole conductivity increased with the ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Based on the measured data, the leakage current densities were calculated for SOFCs with each of the investigated electrolyte materials and an area-specific resistance of 0.383 Omega cm(2).
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: BZCYSc showed the minimum leakage current density, with a value of 3.7% of the external current density at 600 C-omicron.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Therefore, this study indicates that BZCYSc is the most desirable among the materials investigated for use as SOFCs electrolyte.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance

Sentencas: However, for BZCYSc to be used as SOFCs electrolyte material, a protective layer is needed to ensure its chemical stability.
Titulo: Physicochemical properties of Ba(Zr,Ce)O3-δ-based proton-conducting electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of chemical stability and electrochemical performance
